Have a look at my CV

Hi, I'm Chris, an ambitious and motivated developer, hoping to play a part in the development of the web. I joined Le Wagon batch in July 2018, where I built a few projects using Ruby on Rails, which you can check out here. Before that, I spent a few months learning front-end, where I taught myself to use frameworks such as ReactJS and Angular 2.0+, and tools such as Webpack.

Busk

Discover live street performances near you, in real time

View the project

View the source code on Github

Busk was completed during the last two weeks at Le Wagon as the final project. Busk was made with Ruby on Rails, integrated with webpack, and is a web app aimed at smartphone users, as it enables user to search for performances nearby using Google's geolocation services. A contribution model was also implemented, allowing users to contribute to their favourite busker. PostgreSQL was used as the database.

Also implemented: Pundit (Rails), Devise (Rails), Flatpicker(Rails), Swiper (JS), Stripe Payments API

Tag It

Connecting graffiti artists with people who want their walls painted!

View the project

View the source code on Github

Tag It was the second project completed at Le Wagon, designed around the Air Bnb MVC model, and using Ruby on Rails. Users could be an artist or(/and) a wall owner. The app aimed to connect both types of users via the map interface. Artists can also have a gallery of their completed artworks/walls after they have gone through the process of choosing a wall, messaging the owner, setting up a time/date to paint the wall (all of which happen within the app).

Cocktail Town

A cocktail app- add your own cocktails and share with friends

View the project

View the source code on Github

Cocktail Town was a solo project done with Ruby on Rails. The concept is to create a CRUD website where anyone can add their own cocktails. Here, integrating Rails forms with the "show" page enables the user to edit a cocktail on the same page as they go to view a cocktail.

TwoDaystoAlaska

Official website for the debut album of artist TwoDaystoAlaska

View the project

A front-end website with some page-flipping javascript features and a unique UI/UX design. This was the second website that I both designed and coded (the first website being Rika Hemmi's website). Here, an old vanilla JS script was adapted to enable the effect of flipping through the album's booklet (see the script code here). With the current backlash against Jquery, I thought it would be a useful learning experience to create this script using vanilla Javascript.
